Study shows dip in Chinese takeovers amid European investment concernsChina's economic challenges paired with wariness towards Chinese investment in Europe contributed to a decline in the number of takeovers by Chinese buyers on the continent last year, according to a study by auditing and consulting company EY. Tue, 27 Feb 2024 10:30:55 GMT 43XHRJIEG5IS3KTJPICZSULJBI https://www.reuters.com/business/study-shows-dip-chinese-takeovers-amid-european-investment-concerns-2024-02-27/Reuters商业
India's thermal coal imports seen falling for first time since pandemicIndia's thermal coal imports are expected to fall for the first time this year since the COVID-19 pandemic due to increasing domestic output and record high inventories, industry officials said on Tuesday. Alibaba's South Asian e-commerce giant Daraz announces layoffs in memoAlibaba-owned e-commerce platform Daraz Group has announced layoffs across the group to "adopt a more streamlined and agile structure", acting Chief Executive Officer James Dong said on Tuesday in an internal memo to employees reviewed by Reuters. Dental implant maker Straumann cautious for 2024, bets on China growthSwiss dental implant maker Straumann on Tuesday forecast steady 2024 sales growth, taking a cautious stance amidst prolonged economic uncertainty. India's Apr-Jan steel imports at six-year high as China shipments surgeIndia's steel imports touched a six-year high in the first 10 months of the fiscal year to March, led by Chinese shipments, and India was a net importer of finished steel, according to provisional government data seen by Reuters on Tuesday. China wine dispute may be resolved in weeks, Australian trade minister saysA trade dispute with China over tariffs on Australian wine may be resolved "in a few weeks' time", Australian Trade Minister Don Farrell said on Tuesday, removing one of the final obstacles curbing its exports to China. Tue, 27 Feb 2024 06:11:07 GMT OZ7QV4RAIZMD5FPZRUGA62LIKI https://www.reuters.com/business/china-wine-dispute-may-be-resolved-weeks-australian-trade-minister-says-2024-02-27/Alasdair Pal商业
Vietnam plans union reform to avert trade woes, risking foreign firms' uneaseCommunist-ruled Vietnam is expected to ratify this year the UN convention for the free establishment of trade unions, UN officials and diplomats said, in a move meant to cut risks of trade disputes but likely leaving some foreign companies uneasy. China's COMAC to showcase C919, ARJ21 jets in 5 Southeast Asian countriesChinese state-owned planemaker COMAC will conduct flying displays of its C919 and ARJ21 jets in five Southeast Asian countries, it said on Tuesday, as it looks to lay the groundwork for future international sales. Exclusive: StanChart suspends new offshore channel investments by China clientsStandard Chartered has suspended new investments by its clients in China into offshore products via a quota-based channel, the bank said, amid a surge in demand for overseas investments due to weakness in the local market and currency. Soaring Japanese equities offer investors cozy distance from troubled ChinaAs economic and geopolitical woes spur an exodus of investors from China, many have been redirecting money into Japan, giving the benchmark Nikkei an extra boost as it rockets to all-time highs. European stocks edge higher, yen up after inflation dataEuropean stock indexes rose slightly in early trading on Tuesday, as the equity rally slowed and investors weighed up the outlook for central bank rate cuts, ahead of key U.S. and European inflation data later in the week.
